What It Is: Propolis is plant resin collected by bees to seal and sanitise the hive; beekeepers scrape and extract it for use.
Harvesting & Processing: Use propolis mats or scrape from frames and roofs; chill to make brittle; macerate in high-proof ethanol; filter and bottle.
Properties & Uses: Used in lozenges, sprays, and salves for its resinous, aromatic profile; composition varies with local flora.
Market & Value: Clarity, alcohol percentage, and label accuracy drive customer trust; provide batch info and storage guidance.
